choices.text: Both Assertion and Reason are true, and Reason is the correct explanation for Assertion.
Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation for Assertion.
Assertion is true but Reason is false.

questions.text:
Regarding CAD
Assertion: Surgery is indicated when a carotid artery is completely occluded
Reason: Due to severe recurrent symptoms in all patients after complete occlusion
questions.solution: Surgery is generally not indicated when carotid artery is known to be completely occluded because the surgical risk for performing a thrombectomy of a chronically occluded ICA is high. Additionally, most patients do not experience recurrent symptoms after has become completely occluded because embolization is unlikely to occur once the stream of blood flow over the plaque has ceased.

questions.text: For reimplantation surgery, the detached digit or limp is best preserved in
questions.solution: The amputated part is cleaned with a sterile isotonic solution, wrapped in moist sterile gauze. It should be then sealed in waterproof bag. This bag are now placed in container of ice and sent to the reimplantation center. Note: Permissible ischemic time is maximum 8 hours for proximal amputation where as 12 hours for the digits.

questions.text: Which anatomic location is the most common site of extra-adrenal pheochromocytomas?
questions.solution: Pheochromocytomas arise from neuroectodermal cells and are most often found within the adrenal medulla. Ten percent of all pheochromocytomas are located outside of the adrenal gland along the embryologic path of the adrenal gland. The most common site of an extra adrenal pheochromocytoma is in the paraaortic area.

questions.text: The intense pain associated with a felon occurs because of
questions.solution: A felon is an infection of the distal pulp space of a digit, usually secondary to a puncture wound. This is a closed space at the level of the distal interphalangeal joint. Since the infection cannot spread proximal to this point, pain is throbbing and intense. Late osteomyelitis may develop in the distal phalanx if the felon is not opened appropriately.

questions.text: When a patient is seen with a slab wound of the neck that has injured the left vertebral artery, the most frequent clinical finding is
questions.solution: With the injury described, neurologic findings are very rare and gross hemorrhagic shock is unusual. A stable hematoma is the most common presentation.

choices.text: Seen in Von Hippel Lindau Syndrome

questions.text: About hemangioblastoma all are true except
questions.solution:
It is the most common posterior fossa tumour of adult

It occur spontaneously or as part of VHL (Von Hippel Lindau disease)

Commonest site - cerebellum

Histological benign tumour

Many tumour appear as cystic lesion with enhancing area on cyst wall known as mural nodule

Presentation:

Headache - Ataxia

Vertigo - Dysmetria

Treatment - Surgical excision of solid component

questions.text: A 24 year old man is brought into the emergency department after a fall from a ladder. His breathing is labored and he is cyanotic. No breath sounds can be heard even in the right lung field, which is resonant to percussion. The first step in his management should be
questions.solution: This patient has a tension pneumothorax and immediate management by needle thoracotomy is imperative. This diagnosis is a clinical one and treatment should not await x-ray confirmation. After some of the pneomothorax has been relieved, then we may go for tube thoracostomy.

questions.text: After renal transplantation which of the following cancer is very common?
questions.solution: The most common lesions are cancer of the skin and lips and carcinoma in situ of the cervix, as well as lymphomas such as non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.

questions.text: Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment for a 32-year-old male with a toxic nodular goiter and compressive airway symptoms?
questions.solution:
Therapy with antithyroid medications or beta blocker may help alleviate symptoms but is not definitive, especially if the patient possesses local symptoms of compression. Radioiodine therapy is not effective as in Grave's disease because of lower uptake.

I131 ablation may be used in patients who are unsuitable for surgery but because of the high failure rate, local resection is considered the treatment of choice. For solitary nodules, nodulectomy or thyroid lobectomy is the treatment of choice. For solitary nodules nodulectomy or thyroid lobectomy is the treatment of choice.

questions.text: Stafne bone cyst is
Squamous Cell carcinoma of urinary bladder is frequently associated with
questions.solution:
Transitional cell carcinoma is most common carcinoma of bladder.

Occupations with a risk of carcinoma bladder,

  • Dye worker
  • Tyre rubber
  • Petrol worker
  • Shoe maker
  • Painters and hairdressers
  • Schistosoma haematobium infestation (Bilharziasis) is associated with squamous cell carcinoma of urinary bladder.

questions.text: Which of the following is common in extramedullary intradural location?
questions.solution:
Intradural, extramedullary tumours

It is found within the dura but outside the substance of spinal cord.

Most tumours are benign

Common tumours are:

  • Meningioma
  • Schwannoma
  • Neurofibroma

Most common primary spinal tumor

  • Nerve sheath tumor

Most common extradural tumor - Metastasis

Most common intramedullary tumor: Ependymoma

questions.text: Which of the following requires emergency operation in setting without tertiary care facilities?
questions.solution: Extradural hematoma is a surgical emergency. The death will occur if not removed early. Therefore it can be removed even in small set up without any tertiary care facilities.

questions.text: A lady presents with galactorrhea and visual defects. First investigation of choice
questions.solution:
1. MRI is the imaging of choice for pituitary tumour. It is preferred over CT scan.
  2. Here the galactorrhea with visual defect represent pituitary tumour i.e. prolactinoma. Thus first investigation is MRI but serum prolactin should also be measured.
  3. Level more than 200ng/ml is diagnostic of prolactinoma

questions.text: The commonest space occupying lesion (S.O.L.) in the cerebellopontine angle is
questions.solution:
Common tumours of CP (cerebellopontine) angle are

  1. Acoustic neuroma (commonest: 80-90%)
  2. Meningioma (2nd commonest:5-10%)

Since acoustic neuroma is not in option next common is meningioma.

questions.text: Radiological sign of raised intracranial tension in a child is
questions.solution:
Radiological sign of raised intracranial tension is

  1. Sutural separation (diastasis)
  2. Copper beating marking of the cranial vault
  3. Thinning of the dorsum sellae
  4. Erosion of posterior clinoid processes.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a feature of stauffer syndrome?
questions.solution: Stauffer syndrome is a constellation of signs and symptoms of liver dysfunction that arise due to presence of renal cell carcinoma but are not due to tumour infiltration into the liver and/or intrinsic liver disease; it is a paraneoplastic syndrome.

questions.text: Young man with a UTI should be treated with antibiotics for:
questions.solution: Bacterial UTI in women should be treated with 3 days of antibiotics. In men, bacterial UTI should be treated with 7 days, of antibiotics and younger men should be evaluated for correctable structure anomalies with an IVU or CT scan with IV contrast and a cystoscopy.

questions.text: Treatment of medullary carcinoma thyroid
questions.solution:
Total thyroidectomy is the treatment of choice for patients with MTC because of the high incidence of multicentricity, the more aggressive course and 131 I therapy is not usually effective.

The central compartment nodes are frequently involved early in the disease process, so that a bilateral central neck node dissection should be routinely performed.

In patients with palpable cervical nodes or involved central neck nodes ipsilateral or bilateral modified radical neck dissection is recommended.

choices.text: It is difficult to differentiate it from anaplastic carcinoma
If it involves the isthmus it may present with respiratory insufficiency

questions.text: All of the following statements are true regarding Thyroid lymphoma except:
questions.solution:
About thyroid lymphoma:

  • Often arises in back ground of Hashimoto's thyroiditis.
  • Presents as rapidly enlarging thyroid mass
  • MC type- diffuse large cell variant
  • Histology shows: sheets of lymphoid cells
  • Histological difficult to distinguish from small cell lung cancer

questions.text: Paraplegia after operative repair of coarctation of the aorta is usually caused by
questions.solution: Paraplegia is an infrequent but disastrous complication of the operation. It is usually caused by aortic cross clamping and is associated with a fall in distal aortic pressure. When a long cross- clamping period (greater than 20 to 30min) or a drop in distal aortic pressure below 50 to 60 mmHg is anticipated, the use of an intra operative shunt may prevent this problem.

questions.text: A 25-yrs-old man presents with a history of severe reflux oesophagitis. Which one of the following is the treatment of choice?
questions.solution: NICE guidelines support the stance of most gastroenterologists to use an effective. proton pump inhibitor, the dose of which is reduced once symptoms come under control. In patients of this age, who are unlikely to be taking other drugs and so are not at risk of drug interactions, price is the main determinant of the choice of PPI. A cost effectiveness study has shown that the anti reflux surgery is not useful in most patients, as they relapse later and then take PPI therapy once more.

questions.text: BRCA1 is found on which chromosome
questions.solution: About half of women with hereditary breast cancer have mutations in gene BRCA1 (on chromosome 17q21.3) and an additional one third have mutations in BRCA2(on chromosome I3q12-13)

questions.text: Surgical infections are mostly acquired from
In post op ward of ICU, five pts developed wound infection on same wound, the best way to prevent cross infection/MRSA outbreak in indoor patients is:
questions.solution: The best way to prevent cross infections is by rigorous observance of personal hygiene at all times and through the use of barrier nursing, sanitary practices and other pertinent procedures.

choices.text: Donor bile duct with recipient bile duct
Donor bile duct with duodenum of recipient
Donor bile duct with jejunum of recipient

questions.text: Which is the best way to get bile drainage in donor liver?
questions.solution: The Donor Bile duct joined with recipient duct

questions.text: Full thickness graft can be obtained from all of the following EXCEPT
questions.solution:
Donor site selection is an important component of skin grafting should take into account the characteristic of the recipient site. Match thickness, texture, pigmentation and presence or absence of hair as closely as possible. Full thickness graft may be harvested from the upper eyelid, nasolabial fold, preauricular and postauricular region and supraclavicular fossa.

These donor sites often used to close a wound on face or neck.

questions.text: 'Bisgaard's regime' is for the treatment of
questions.solution:
BISGAARD REGIMEN OF VENOUS ULCER

  1. Massage in elevation to whole leg, particularly around the ulcer
  2. Passive movements of limb
  3. Active movements of calf muscles
  4. Walking by placing heel down first and using calf muscles to lift the heel.
  5. Firm elastic bandage from base of the toes to the knee
  6. Antiseptic dressing

choices.text: 5% phenol in almond or arachis oil

questions.text: Solution for haemorrhoids
questions.solution: First or second degree piles not relieved by conservative measures - sclerotherapy (submucosal injection of 5% phenol in arachis or almond oil in the apex of the pile pedicle)

choices.text: They occur most commonly on the lips, tongue, and palate.
They rarely recur if simply enucleated

questions.text: Pleomorpic adenomas (mixed tumors) of the salivary glands are characterized by which of the following?
questions.solution:
There are approximately 400-700 minor salivary glands in the oral cavity. Pleomorphic adenomas (mixed tumors) can occur in any of them. These round tumors have a rubbery consistency and are slow growing; all are potentially malignant.

The sites most commonly affected by pleomorphic adenomas of the salivary glands are the lips, tongue and palate.

choices.text: Bifid pubic symphysis/separation of pubic symphysis

questions.text: Epispadias is associated with:
questions.solution:
Epispadias is a rare anomaly in which normal urethra is replaced by a broad, mucosal strip lining the dorsum of penis extending towards the bladder, with incompetence of the sphincter mechanism.

Male epispadias is usually (70%) associated with exstrophy of the bladder.

Epispadias results from defective migration of the primordium of the genital tubercles

Displaced meatus may be found on glans, penile shaft

choices.text: Both Assertion and Reason are true, and Reason is the correct explanation for assertion
Both assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation for assertion
Assertion is true but Reason is false
Assertion is false but Reason is true

questions.text:
Regarding: Dermatofibrosarcoma
Assertion: Very large size at the time of diagnosis
Reason: It is a sarcoma arising from dermal fibroblasts
questions.solution:
Dermatofibrosarcoma protuberans is a low grade sarcoma arising from dermal fibroblasts. The lesion appears as a smooth nodule in or immediately beneath the skin (trunk 40%; head/neck, 40%) in mid adult life. Because of their slow growth, lesions are commonly 1 to 2 cms at diagnosis.

Treatment consists of Wide Local Excision with 3 to 4cm margins.

questions.text: Most Common posterior mediastinal tumor is:

A 70-year-old man undergoes resection of an abdominal aortic aneurysm. Two days later he has drainage of dark blood per rectum and colonic ischemia is suspected. To establish the diagnosis, it is most appropriate to order
questions.solution: Abdominal x-rays are non specific. Since the inferior mesenteric artery is sacrificed during the dissection, contrast angiography will not provide new information. Either barium enema or enhanced ct scan can be effective in defining chronic bowel ischemia but these studies are not appropriate in an acute situation. Flexible sigmoidoscopy allows visualization of the colonic mucosa and aids in the decision to observe the patient or reoperate.

questions.text: Symptoms from a retroperitoneal sarcoma are usually produced by
questions.solution: Retroperitoneal sarcomas grow along fascial planes and envelop rather than invade retroperitoneal organs. Lymph node metastases are unusual. The tumour does not usually grow rapidly enough to outgrow its blood supply and major hemorrhage into the tumour mass is uncommon.

choices.text: Both Assertion and Reason are true, and Reason is the correct explanation for assertion
Both assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not the correct explanation for assertion
Assertion is true but Reason is false
Assertion is false but Reason is true

questions.text:
Regarding: burns management
Assertion: Intramuscular or subcutaneous narcotic injection for pain are never used
Reason: drug absorption is decreased as a result of the peripheral vasoconstriction
questions.solution: Intramuscular or subcutaneous narcotic injections for pain are never used because drug absorption is decreased as a result of the peripheral vasoconstriction. This might become a problem later when the patient is resuscitated and vasodilation increases absorption of the narcotic depot with resulting apnea. Small doses of intravenous (IV) morphine may be given after complete assessment of the patient and once it is determined to be safe by an experienced practitioner.

questions.text: Which of the following is protective against carcinoma colon?
questions.solution: Fiber: Diets high in fiber and low in fat helps to reduce the amount of estrogen circulating in the blood. Fiber is also important in preventing colon cancer, as it helps to move food waste, extra hormones and carcinogens out of the body. Fiber may even help the immune system function properly. Building a diet from fiber rich plant foods is important for cancer prevention and survival as well as overall health.

questions.text: Thoracic outlet syndrome is diagnosed by
questions.solution:
There are no specific diagnostic test for thoracic outlet syndromes.

The diagnosis is made by ruling out other disease and by observing the patient.

Two nonspecific tests that can suggest the presence of thoracic outlet syndrome are the Adson test and the allen test.

In the Adson test, the patient takes a deep breath and tilts his or her head head back and turn it to one side.The physician tests to see if the strength of the patients pulse is reduced in the wrist on the arm on the opposite side of the head turn.

In the Allen test, the arm in which the patient is experiencing symptoms is raised and rotated while the head is turned to the opposite side.The physician tests to see if the pulse strength at the wrist is reduced.

If the strength of the pulse is reduced in either of these two tests it indicates compression of the subclavian artery.

questions.text: Lung-volume reduction operations have been developed as a method of managing patients with
questions.solution: In a patient with diffuse severe emphysema, resection or part of the damaged lung may allow the patient's residual lung to function more efficiently. This technique may serve either as an alternative to lung transplantation or as bridge until an appropriate donor organ is available.

questions.text: The most common arrhythmia associated with laparoscopic surgery is?
questions.solution: The most common arrhythmia created by laparoscopy is bradycardia. A rapid stretch of the peritoneal membrane often causes a vagovagal response with bradycardia and occasionally hypertension. The appropriate management of this event is desufflation of the abdomen, administration of vagolytic agents(e.g., atropine) and adequate volume replacement.

choices.text: Breast cancer occurs more commonly among women of the lower social classes
A history of breast cancer in a first-degree family relative is associated with a fourfold increase in risk
Women with a first birth after age 30 years have approximately twice the risk of those with a first birth before age 18.
Cigarette smoking increases the risk of breast cancer.

questions.text: Regarding the risk of breast cancer, which of the following statements is true?
questions.solution: Risk factors for breast cancer include family history nulliparity, previous breast cancer, early menarche and late menopause. A late age at first birth (after age 30) doubles the risk of breast cancer compared with early parity (age 18 or earlier). Having one first degree relative (mother sister or daughter) with breast cancer also doubles the risk. Women of the upper social classes as measured by either education or income have been found to have the highest incidence of breast cancer. Neither cigarette smoking nor the use of hair dye has been correlated with breast cancer.

choices.text: Is related to dietary fat intake
Is related to vitamin C intake

questions.text: True about the incidences of breast cancer:
questions.solution: Breast cancer is rarely seen before the age of 20, but thereafter its incidence increases inexorably While the prevalence of breast cancer (the raw number of patients alive with disease) is greatest among perimenopausal women, the incidence of breast cancer (the number of new cases per 1,00,000) population rises so sharply as it is twice as common among women between 80 and 85 years of age as among those 60 to 65.

choices.text: Intralesional steroid should be avoided as it increases chances of recurrence

questions.text: False about keloid
questions.solution:
Keloid

  • Results from excessive proliferation of immature fibroblast and immature blood vessels which extends beyond the original wound.
  • It tends to occur in 3 months to 3 years after injury.
  • More common in Afro Caribbean races.

Most common sites are:

  • Presternal area
  • Ear lobe
  • Upper back region

Most characteristic feature of keloid is recurrence after surgical exicision
Treatment:

  • Intralesional steroids (Triamcinolone) combined with surgical excision is best
  • Isolated excision leads to recurrence in almost all cases, so it is indicated only for debulking larger lesions and as a second line when other measures fails.
  • Surgical excision with postoperative interstitial radiotherapy decreases chance of recurrence and is indicated in unresponsive cases.
  • Topical retinoids can also be used.
  • Excision and steroid injection

Complication:

  • Recurrence(most common)
  • Ulceration
  • Infection

choices.text: Most common congenital anomaly of small bowel

questions.text: False about Meckel's diverticulum is
questions.solution:
• Meckels diverticulum is the most prevalent congenital anomaly of the gastrointestinal tract, affecting approximately 2 % of the general population.
  • A 3:2 male to female prevalence ration has been reported.
  • Meckel's diverticula are designated true diverticula because their walls contain all of the layers found in normal small intestine.
  • Their location varies among individual patients, but they are usually found in the ileum within 100cm of the ileocecal valve.
  • Approximately 60% of Meckel's diverticula contain heterotopic mucosa of which more than 60% consist of gastric mucosa.
  • Pancreatic acini are the next most common; other include Brunner's glands, pancreatic islets, colonic mucosa, endometriosis and hepatobiliary tissues.
  • A useful, although crude, mnemonic describing Meckel's diverticula is the 'rule of twos':2% prevalence, 2:1 female predominance location 2 feet proximal to the ileocecal valve in adults and half of those who are symptomatic are younger than 2 years of age.

questions.text: Fecal fistula after appendicectomy may occur due to

choices.text: Carry out a metastatic workup including CT Scans of the head and the liver

questions.text: A 60-year-old woman with a mass in the right pulmonary hilum is found by sputum cytology to have a small cell carcinoma. At this time, appropriate management is to
questions.solution: Small cell carcinoma of the lung accounts for about 20 percent of lung cancers. This type of cancer is aggressive and metastasizes early. Operation is not an appropriate choice. Palliation is better achieved with radiation therapy and chemotherapy without other costly and time consuming procedures.

questions.text: In a patient with epidermoid carcinoma of the right lung, the finding which indicates the worst prognosis is
questions.solution: Chronic cough, hemoptysis and obstructive pneumonitis may occur while the tumor is confined to the lung. Hoarseness implies recurrent laryngeal nerve involvement in the superior mediastinum and the outlook is poor when this finding is present.

questions.text: The ability of the lung to tolerate operation or injury without persistent air leaks is primarily dependent on the
questions.solution: The visceral and parietal pleural surfaces form a physiologically active membrane that transmits fluids, carries phagocytes of cells and debris and seals air and capillary leaks.

questions.text: Video-assisted thoracic surgery (VATS) is currently recommended for each of the following procedures EXCEPT
questions.solution:
Video assisted thoracoscopic surgery(VATS) has become an accepted approach to diagnosis and treatment of pleural effusions, recurrent pneumonthoraces, lung biopsies, lobotomy, resection of bronchogenic and mediastinal cysts, esophageal myotomy and intrathoracic esophageal mobilization for esophagectomy. VATS is performed via two to four incisions measuring 0.5 to 1.2 cm in length to allow insertion of the thoracoscope and instruments. Endoscopic staplers are used to divide the major vascular structures and bronchus.

The lung is then ventilated and placed under positive pressure ventilation to assist with reexpansion of atelectatic segments.

questions.text: Following thoracotomy each of the following is decreased EXCEPT
questions.solution: VC and all its subdivisions (ERV < PRC < TV) are decreased after any abdominal or thoracic operation Because of early airway closure, CV is increased.
